fields.primaryText: Opens mouth for breast or bottle
Sucks and swallows liquid
Swallows pureed food (smooth, almost liquid) fed with spoon
Puts one or both hands on bottle while drinking
Mouths blended or strained(some texture) foods fed by spoon
Holds bottle independently while lying on back
Mouths and gums cookie or cracker
Drinks from a cup when an adult holds it
Bites off piece of food
Feeds self with fingers
Chews soft foods
Holds spoon
Brings spoon to mouth, but not self-feeding
Eats 3 new foods of different textures
Makes effort to help undress self:tries to remove garment
Co operates while being dressed: holds out arms and legs
Holds lidded cup independently while drinking
Feeds self with spoon with some spillage
When drinking from a cup, picks up and replaces it on table when done drinking
Locates and uses own cup, spoon, dish when sitting at the tble
Uses straw to slip liquid
Holds spoon with adult(tripod) grasp
Drinks from a glass
Serves self finger foods from platter
Feeds self meal using hand/spoon
Pours from small pitcher into glass
Takes small bites, chews food thoroughly and with mouth closed, when prompted
Serves self from bowl with serving spoon
Cleans up spills, getting own cloth
Clears own place at table
Helps set table
Opens a variety of individually-packged food and drink container
Pours juice, milk, etc. with little or no spilling
Uses simple condiments(squeezable containers, salt and pepper shakers)
Passes dishes and serves self food using utensils
Mixes rices, dal and eats with hands/spoon
Removes Socks independently
Assists in dressing putting arms or legs through
Removes Shoes when laces are untied and loosened
Removes dress when unfastened
Unzips zipper with minimal assistance
Zips engaged zipper on shirt
Attempts to independently put on an item of clothing
Pulls pants up down with assistance
Takes off pullover shirt
Takes off all clothing which has been unfastened
Unsnaps clothing
Unbuttons large front buttons
Puts on socks
Puts on or front-opening shirt
Puts on pants and pullover shirt independently
Orients clothing (front and back)
Fastens Velcro straps on shoes or sandals
Snaps own clothing
Buttons own shirt
Chooses between 2 offered items of clothing
Completes dressing and undressing independently (may still want of need help with fasteners)
Selects or requests some items of own clothing
Puts shirt on hanger and replaces hanger on low bar
Places shoes on correct feet
Obtains own clothing from closet and drawers
Folds clean clothing and puts clothing away in drawers
Places dirty clothing in an appropriate place
Co operates when face and hands are washed
Tolerates adult brushing hair or wiping nose with tissue
Shows awareness of being wet or soiled
Shows some regularity or pattern to elimination
Sits on potty and occasionally urinates or defecates in it
Has day time control of bowl and bladder(may have occasional accidents: may want or need help with clothing)
Flushes toilet with reminder
Washes hands with soup and water(may need assistance with soap)
Dries hands with towel
Turns water faucet on and off
Wipes and blows own nose when assisted
Wakes from sleep during the night to use toilet or stays dry all night
Completes toileting procedure effectively at home
Hangs up washcloth or hand towel
Uses Paper towel dispenser in public washroom
Places trash in waste basket
Checks own privacy when toileting in familiar public restrooms
Removes underwear/ pant before sitting on toilet set
Washes self after use of the toilet
Applies paste on the tooth brush
Brushes teeth with assistance
Brushes teeth independently
Spits past
Cleans the tongue
Pours water on self for bathing
Wipes face with towel / cloth
Washes face with soap and water
Uses towel for drying body
Removes soap from body with water
Applies soap on body
Applies powder on face/body
Oils hair
Cuts nails with nail cutter / scissors
Puts on wrist watch
Plats hair (female) / combs hair with parting (male)
Looks after menstrual hygiene (female) / shaves (male)
Avoids hazards when in a familiar place
Delivers items to appropriate location or room when asked
Attempts to get own drink (from refrigerator or top)
Helps wipe table with sponge or washcloth
Puts away toys in designed storage areas
Participates in some shopping activities
Avoids common dangers around the home
Is aware of and avoids places where known poisons (Cleansers, etc.) are stored
Regularly completes one task independently without supervision (may need reminder)
Makes own bed with assistance
Buckles own seat belt in the car
Knows and calls own phone number
Locates and uses drinking fountain and restroom at
